channel.title: GUI to Applet
channel.description:
I was wondering if it is very difficult to convert a java gui to a java applet.
Originally, the program I was creating was supposed to be a standalone app with a gui. I've been thinking this through, and decided that it would be better to create the program as a applet and host it on a website.
I've never really worked extensively with applets and just had one main question. How do I make my interface into an applet? Do I just have to create an instance of JApplet, then add all of my components and containers to that?
Any help would be greatly appreciated.

item.title: GUI to Applet
item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

1337 summed it up pretty well. any methods you don’t need, just keep empty and the code should compile and run nicely

Read full topic

item.title: GUI to Applet
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

java gui and java applet are completly different. Do you mean JFrame and JApplet? JFrame to JApplet = piece of cake.

make it extend JApplet and add all the methods (init, paint, start, stop, some more i think), and in init() put the gui adding part and instead of adding to the jframe (or this) add to this.

Read full topic

item.title: GUI to Applet
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

If you wrote it, and the application isnt very complex, it should be easy to make it an applet too

Read full topic
